bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Pathological Condition of a feeling of deep-seated heaviness in the entire body or parts of it, accompanied by a sensation of sagging. Tai ping hui min he ji Recipe book. Northern Song, ju fang 1107~1110. 太平惠民和劑局方 5 ：腰痛，或腰間似有物重墜，起 坐艱辛者，悉能治之 , “Cases of lower back pain occasionally with a feeling as if there were some heavy, sagging item in the lumbar region, making rising and sitting down very difficult, they can all be cured”.

②A characterization of pharmaceutical substances when their mass is very heavy and when they have a tendency to move downwards in the body. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry jin 金：豈知血肉之軀，水穀為賴，可能堪此金石重墜之物久在腸胃 乎 , “How does one know that the human body, consisting of blood and flesh and depending on a supply of water and grain, could bear such heavy and sagging items as metal and stones in its intestines and stomach?”
